job_title: Sr. Analyst, Line Management Optimization & Valuation
job_Description: Merrick Bank employees share in our mission to delight our customers and empower underserved consumers to achieve their credit goals. In return, we delight our associates; ensuring they are noticed, heard, appreciated and understand the importance of their role(s). For over 20 years, our Guiding Principles of; doing the right thing, putting the customer first, and Earn, Learn, Have Fun (aka E.L.F.), have defined who we are as an Employer of Choice. Give Yourself Credit, Work at Merrick!      The senior analyst position supports existing customer line management programs, strategy evaluation, testing and ongoing optimization. A strong candidate will have extensive mathematical or statistical experience building forecasts and utilizing tools like ANOVA, F Test, and Regression analysis. The primary responsibilities include the creation, management, and auditing of various programs and initiatives as it relates to the overall line increase/line decrease strategies. The position will be responsible for on-going analysis, reporting and testing. This position proposes improvements to existing strategies and seeing those changes through to implementation and post production validation and monitoring.        Essential Functions:          Develops and implements analytical frameworks to monitor and evaluate line management programs performance.     Develops subject matter expertise in portfolio line management strategy and P&L valuation.     Identify optimization opportunities, design tests and make strategic recommendations for future improvement.     Owns existing reporting, analysis and dashboard, and creates new reporting as necessary.     Collaborates with key stakeholders across multiple organizations and departments to develop and maintain a rigorous test, learn and growth mechanisms.     Presents results of analysis and proposals for improvements to strategies to senior management.       Compliance with Laws & Regulations:          Responsible for complying with all of the Bank’s internal control policies and procedures.     Responsible for understanding and complying with all laws and regulations to which the Bank is subject.     Responsible for communicating problems in operations, noncompliance with the code of conduct, noncompliance with laws and regulations, violations, or illegal acts.       Education and Experience:          Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or other quantitative discipline with three (3) years analytics experience is required; OR     Masters’ Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or other quantitative discipline with one (1) of analytics experience is required.       Summary of Qualifications:          Comfortable leveraging data analysis tools and working hands-on with large analytical datasets to deliver insights     Requires a firm background and experience in data analytics, machine learning, and advanced programming (such as Python or SAS/SQL)     Additional required skills and experience: organizational skills, effective communication/presentation skills (both verbal and written), and problem solving skills     Demonstrated ability to learn rapidly and solve problems dynamically     Who is Merrick Bank? Founded over 20 years ago, Merrick Bank is a FDIC-insured Utah Industrial Loan Bank that originates loans with the benefit of low-cost deposit funding. Merrick Bank had $4.5 billion in assets and $3.1 billion in deposits as of March 31, 2021. Merrick Bank operates four main business lines: Credit Cards, Recreation Lending, Personal Loans and Merchant Acquiring.      Our Valued Employees are provided generous benefits, including:         Competitive Pay     Benefits Package -Medical, Dental and Vision (plus much more)     401(k) Plan with Company Match     Short & Long Term Disability     Group Life and AD&D Insurance     Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days     Employee Events, including Employee Appreciation Day, Holiday Party, etc.     Tuition Reimbursement Program     Candidates must have unrestricted authority to work in the United States without sponsorship.      Merrick Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristic.   Merrick Bank will do a thorough background check for all hires. The EEOC Law poster is available here: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm Please go to our website www.merrickbank.com to apply and learn more about our company.

Company Description    We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.           Job Description    Ensure the overall quality and customer satisfaction for the product(s) for which your team is responsible through analysis of design / requirements documentation, required testing and Production implementation. Contribute to continuously improving the quality of your team’s product subject matter expertise, understanding of development and testing processes. Collaborate with business and technical representatives to provide input on established requirements / specifications and standards for bug fixes and enhancements for your team’s product(s). Actively valuate and test software programs to verify functionality against established requirements / specifications and development and security standards to ensure the product(s) work as expected. Actively collaborate with Developers Product and other Quality Assurance team members to ensure project delivery deadlines are met. Act as a representative of the Quality Assurance team to customers and other departments in coordinating efforts, fielding concerns, and prioritizing work.     Essential functions:     1. Utilize programming skills and available testing technologies to create automated tests to run against web, desktop, and mobile applications.  2. Work closely with project managers, product, manual QA, and development to understand features and create comprehensive automated tests to validate functionality  3. Gain an understanding of the automation framework to diagnose and fix issues as required.  4. Understand how to execute and analyze both automated and manual test cases and evaluate their results.  5. Conduct as appropriate ad-hoc technical training, design and code reviews, and help to resolve technical issues for the test automation suite.  6. Produce clear and detailed reports that reflect open issues for QA, development, and management groups to review.  7. Work closely with multiple teams to deliver on the goals and schedules set by management.  8. Document software defects using a bug tracking system and report defects to software developers and management.  9. Regular and consistent attendance           Qualifications    1. Gain familiarity with various testing types and techniques: black box, white box, integration, usability, smoke, negative, acceptance, regression, etc.  2. Ability to utilize automated testing tools such as Selenium, Appium, etc.  3. Excellent written and verbal English skills.  4. The necessary focus to drill deep into software to identify, reproduce, and isolate software defects.  5. 1 year experience working with Software in quality assurance, high school or college education or related certificate programs.  6. Associate or BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical degree preferred  7. Experience in Java, Javascript, Selenium and API testing is a plus.     Working Conditions:     1. Frequent interaction with department team members and members of other Xactware subsidiaries  2. Occasional travel – very rare  3. General office working conditions and environment  4. Occasional exceptional hours as needed to meet deadlines     This job description does not list all the duties of the job. You may be asked by management to perform other duties. You will be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the tasks listed in this job description.     Management has the right to revise this job description at any time.     #LI-MV1     Additional Information    Xactware, a Verisk business, specializes in technologies for the property insurance, remodeling, restoration, and mortgage and lending industries. Xactware’s tools provide claims estimating, contents replacement, claims management, and property maintenance solutions for desktop, mobile, and online platforms. Xactware’s services include repair cost research and reports, aerial imagery, and real-time business intelligence. Xactware has been providing cloud services for customers since 1995. To learn more about Xactware please visit us at: Xactware.com. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!     At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.     Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.     But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.     It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.     At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.     At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. job_title: Director (High Risk Account Management), Portfolio Management Strategy
job_Description: Merrick Bank employees share in our mission to delight our customers and empower underserved consumers to achieve their credit goals. In return, we delight our associates; ensuring they are noticed, heard, appreciated and understand the importance of their role(s). For over 20 years, our Guiding Principles of; doing the right thing, putting the customer first, and Earn, Learn, Have Fun (aka E.L.F.), have defined who we are as an Employer of Choice. Give Yourself Credit, Work at Merrick!      The high risk account management director owns, manages and develops high risk account management strategies to achieve loss mitigation objectives. The strategies and treatments include, but are not limited to, high risk credit line decreases, inactive account closures and payment holds. This position requires analytical skills, strategic thinking, high risk account and exposure management knowledge, and an ability to balance risk/rewards objectively with customer-centric mindset.        Essential Functions:          Owns, designs and manages high risk account management strategies to achieve loss mitigation objectives.     Assesses and recommends changes to strategies, policies, practices and controls for Merrick credit portfolio.     Develops quantitative risk framework and ensure these strategies drive strong financial performance and risk controls.     Designs test and learn framework. Establishes ongoing review and monitoring of performance and profitability of the strategies.     Works with risk oversight, lending operations and IT to support the launch and execution of the strategies with strong controls.     Analyzes portfolio patterns and trends at granular segment level, and conducts data driven analysis using SAS and SQL to isolate high risk population.     Manages necessary documentation and procedures consistent with an audited environment. Responsible for overseeing functional compliance with Bank policies, audit controls, and regulatory requirements.       Compliance with Laws & Regulations:          Responsible for complying with all of the Bank’s internal control policies and procedures.     Responsible for understanding and complying with all laws and regulations to which the Bank is subject.     Responsible for communicating problems in operations, noncompliance with the code of conduct, noncompliance with laws and regulations, policy violations, or illegal acts. Five (5) years of heavy analytics, statistics or equivalent experience in Credit Card Industry or Consumer Finance. Exposure in high risk control or exposure management programs is required.       Summary of Qualifications:          Leader in white space thinking and ability to challenge the status quo     Ability to balance strategic thinking and operational delivery     Synthesizes insights across different sources into a comprehensive and holistic strategy     High degree of comfort drawing well-supported insights from complicated datasets to influence and convey a point of view to the leadership team     Self-motivated and organized; strong collaboration and teamwork skills; and a problem-solver oriented toward achieving results     Proven ability to apply credit and risk principles toward business goals     Candidate must be comfortable working hands-on with large analytical datasets to perform complex analysis and extract business insights     Advanced understanding of SAS, SQL, SAS enterprise miner, or other decision tree software     Familiarity with risk analytic techniques     Ability to work across multiple lines of business and effectively prioritize tasks     Excellent problem solving, attention to detail and the ability to work independently     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills     Who is Merrick Bank? Founded over 20 years ago, Merrick Bank is a FDIC-insured Utah Industrial Loan Bank that originates loans with the benefit of low-cost deposit funding. Merrick Bank operates four main business lines: Credit Cards, Recreation Lending, Personal Loans and Merchant Acquiring. job_title: Vice President of High Throughput Operations
job_Description: Your work will change lives. Including your own.  Recursion is the clinical-stage biotechnology company industrializing drug discovery by decoding biology. Recursion leverages sophisticated machine-learning algorithms to distill from its dataset the Recursion Map, a collection of hundreds of billions of searchable inferences across biology and chemistry unconstrained by human bias. Eight years ago, we were staining plates by hand. Today, we've created a library of more than one billion cellular images on the basis of a radically different approach to biotech. This is a bold approach that we believe will reinvent drug discovery and development.  If you draw a line from eight years ago to today, you'll see our trajectory and understand that Recursion is a very different kind of company. You cannot make these kinds of leaps simply by adding incubators, fluorescent microscopes, and robots to automate processes at scale. Our drug discovery strategies are map and data-driven rather than target-driven, revealing destinations you might never have considered. And for them to succeed, they require an unconstrained thinker to oversee our high-throughput screening operation.  While we offer cutting-edge tools and an amazing lab, the secret sauce is our people. Everyday you'll face a challenge you've literally never seen before. But you'll be surrounded by humble experts who will happily drop everything to support you, get exposure to a wide range of ideas and approaches, and be asked to think beyond the obvious to solve those challenges. Our organization structure and culture isn't driven by politics or ego, it is designed first and foremost to help you do your best work.  You'll be joining Recursion at an interesting time, both for the company and for the world. The global pandemic has reinforced in everyone's mind not only the importance of therapeutics, but also the critical value that accelerating every phase of drug discovery and development can provide. For most, the notion that "patients can't wait" is abstract; COVID-19 has made this concept all too real for millions, even billions, worldwide. As the Vice President of High Throughput Operations, you'll be in a position to directly accelerate the timeline of getting drugs into the hands of patients who need them.  The Impact You'll Make  You are a key value driver for Recursion as the leader of our high throughput operations across multiple -omics platforms. Specifically, you will have oversight of the compound management, cell culture, phenomics high throughput operations and multi-omics operations teams. In this role, you will   Innovate  in the areas of technology, automation and new scientific approaches to modeling complex biology, human disease and chemical drug development  Deliver  high quality biological and chemical data at an unprecedented scale  Partner  with other senior leaders across technology, science and accelerating functions to deliver on our company mission and strategy  Inspirational leadership  for teams delivering at the intersection of operational excellence and cutting edge science & technology   The Team You'll Join  You will be a senior leader at Recursion, joining a high performing and mission-focused team while leading High Throughput Operations and reporting to the COO. This is a dynamic group of people who are tenacious in scientific problem solving and are rigorous in challenging the status quo. We love delivering against ambitious challenges and we do so in a collaborative environment. The team has achieved unprecedented scale in recent years and you will lead the organization to the next level of technical innovation and operational rigor.  The Experience You'll Need   Demonstrated ability to lead and influence as a senior leader in a fast paced, innovative organization. Prior experience as an executive in a biotechnology, healthcare or life science technology platform company is highly desirable  A background in Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, or related field and >10 years of experience working across multiple relevant functions, including systems engineering, high throughput laboratory automation, process development, research core operations, research biology and/or drug discovery  Proven experience running and scaling high throughput laboratory operations, direct experience in next-generation sequencing, phenomics high throughput screening, cell culture and/or compound management highly desirable  Demonstrated ability to align on the tactics and strategies needed for successful operations, influence cross-functionally, and promote accountability in a positive and efficacious manner  The ability to translate an innovative technology vision into operational reality  Experience developing and implementing efficient and effective operational strategies  Proven leader with experience recruiting and managing high-performing teams and a reputation for maximizing and growing talent  Proven leader with experience influencing at an executive level and translating high level vision and strategy into action across a multi-discipline, multi-layer matrixed organization  Excellent organizational, planning, and analytical skills  Bachelor's degree in a scientific or engineering discipline, a graduate degree is desirable   #LI-CP1 The Values That We Hope You Share:   We Care:  We care about our drug candidates, our Recursionauts, their families, each other, our communities, the patients we aim to serve and their loved ones. We also care about our work.  We Learn:  Learning from the diverse perspectives of our fellow Recursionauts, and from failure, is an essential part of how we make progress.  We Deliver:  We are unapologetic that our expectations for delivery are extraordinarily high. There is urgency to our existence: we sprint at maximum engagement, making time and space to recover.  Act Boldly with Integrity:  No company changes the world or reinvents an industry without being bold. It must be balanced; not by timidity, but by doing the right thing even when no one is looking.  We are One Recursion:  We operate with a 'company first, team second' mentality. Our success comes from working as one interdisciplinary team.   Recursion spends time and energy connecting every aspect of work to these values. They aren't static, but regularly discussed and questioned because we make decisions rooted in those values in our day-to-day work. You can read more about our values and how we live them every day here.  Recursion requires all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to their first date of employment.  More About Recursion  Central to our mission is the Recursion Operating System, or Recursion OS, that combines an advanced infrastructure layer to generate what we believe is one of the world's largest and fastest-growing proprietary biological and chemical datasets and the Recursion Map, a suite of custom software, algorithms, and machine learning tools that we use to explore foundational biology unconstrained by human bias and navigate to new biological insights which may accelerate our programs. We are a biotechnology company scaling more like a technology company. Recursion is proudly headquartered in Salt Lake City.  Learn more at www.recursion.com, or connect on Twitter and LinkedIn.  Recursion is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, local, or provincial human rights legislation.
